client

Class LANClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.esotericsoftware.kryonet.Connection
      • com.esotericsoftware.kryonet.Client
        • client.LANClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.esotericsoftware.kryonet.EndPoint, java.lang.Runnable

    public class LANClient
extends com.esotericsoftware.kryonet.Client
    LANClient manages all communication with the LANServer and to the GUI.

    It handles the communication as an interface to the GUI and implements all needed back-end functionality.

    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • LANClient

        public LANClient()
        Creates the LANClient.

        A writebuffersize of and a objectbuffersize of is used, all listeners get registered. The ClientSettings are loaded, and the LANClient starts searching for an open LANServer.

        Since:
        1.0

      • getGameStatus

        public GameStatus getGameStatus(Game game)
        Generates the GameStatus of the game.

        The local availability, the playability, the updatestatus, the running field, the downloading/unzipping and progress fields are set.

        Parameters:
        game - the game of which the GameStatus will be generated
        Returns:
        GameStatus of the game
        Since:
        1.0

      • updateUser

        public boolean updateUser(User user)
        Updates the User of the LANClient and syncs it with the LANServer.

        On every call an ImageDownloadRequest is made.

        Parameters:
        user - new User object, which is used to copy all information to the current User
        Returns:
        true if any information changed and has been successfully updated and saved, else false
        Since:
        1.0

      • download

        public int download(Game game)
        Downloading the game from the LANServer.
        Parameters:
        game - Game to download
        Returns:
        -1 if the game is downloading already, -2 if the LANClient is not connected to the LANServer, -3 if there is not enough free space on the disk, 0 if the download started successfully.
        Since:
        1.0

      • startGame

        public boolean startGame(Game game,
                         boolean download)
        Starts the game if it is locally available and up-to-date, else download(Game) is called. After the game is started it is passed to the GameMonitor.
        Parameters:
        game - Game to start
        download - true if the game should be downloaded, if locally not available
        Returns:
        true if the game has been successfully started, else false
        Since:
        1.0

      • updateOpenGames

        public void updateOpenGames()
        Updates all running Game managed by the GameMonitor with the LANServer.
        Since:
        1.0

      • updateOpenServers

        public void updateOpenServers()
        Updates all running Game managed by the ServerMonitor with the LANServer.
        Since:
        1.0

      • openExplorer

        public boolean openExplorer(Game game)
        Opens the folder of the game in the explorer.
        Parameters:
        game - Game to open in the explorer
        Returns:
        true if the explorer could be opened, else false
        Since:
        1.0

      • connectServer

        public boolean connectServer(Game game,
                             java.lang.String ip,
                             boolean download)
        Starts the game and connects direct to the server with the ip, if the game is capable of direct connect.

        After the game is started it is passed to the GameMonitor.

        Parameters:
        game - the Game of the server to connect to
        ip - ip-address of the server
        download - true if the game should be downloaded, if locally not available
        Returns:
        true if the game started, else false
        Since:
        1.0

      • startServer

        public boolean startServer(Game game,
                           java.lang.String parameter,
                           boolean download)
        Starts the server of the game.

        If possible a dedicated server is created, else an in-game server is started. The server gets started with the parameter provided from the user. After the game is started it is passed to the ServerMonitor.

        Parameters:
        game - Game to start a server of
        parameter - server command-line arguments
        download - true if the game should be downloaded, if locally not available
        Returns:
        true if the server started, else false
        Since:
        1.0

      • stopDownloadUnzip

        public boolean stopDownloadUnzip(Game game)
        Stops the download or extraction of the game and notifies the LANServer.
        Parameters:
        game - game to stop downloading or extracting.
        Returns:
        always true
        Since:
        1.0

        public UserRunGamesList getUserRunGames()
